title: Information Technology and Accounting
description: This course provides an introduction to the role and use of models and modeling in managerial decision-making. Students will gain hands-on experience in evaluating accounting data using Microsoft Excel. Content includes creating data boxes in financial accounting, using multiple sheets with formulas, preparing professional quality financial reports, and creating graphs to interpret business results. Students will also explore the utility of QuickBooks and the functionality for small businesses. Prerequisites: upper-division standing.
